result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis L Hopinka Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs on count 2, the revoked count, are added to this count for probation to collect all court costs due.    If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Obtain his GED, HSED or it's equivalent.  Seek and maintain employment, commensurate with his treatment and counseling needs, at the agent's discretion.  Not to terminate his employment without his agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by other means with the victims, or any known illegal drug users or dealers.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Defendant to engage with the Ho-Chunk Nation independent living skills coordinator.  Defendant must comply with any recommendations made, and complete all assignments.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

timeConds.notes: Credit for 13 days served on this count.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney Daniel S. Diehn appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss.  Victim notification complied with.  Parties have the revocation packet.  State has no changes or corrections.  In the revocation summary, defendant admits some of the allegations, and denies some of the allegations.   Sentence credit discussed by defense.  290 days total due if sentences run concurrent.  State recommended:  15CF221:  12 month jail sentence.  16CF112:  90 days each count.  All concurrent.  Defense recommended:  15CF221:  12 month jail sentence.  16CF112:  90 days each count.  All concurrent.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  

Court ordered:  15CF221:  9 month jail sentence.  16CF112:  90 days each count.  All concurrent.    Credit for 290 days.  Days counted from front page of the revocation packet, plus additional days of 6/30/17 to July 6/2017.   Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.
from DOC

15CF221.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 3 years probation on Count 1.  6 months jail as a condition of probation on Count 1. Credit for 13 days.   6 months jail, concurrent on Count 2 (Credit for 135 days on this count, time served).      The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent. Not to terminate without his agent's prior approval.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers.   CC.  Pay all court costs, including revoked count, through probation.  Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 22, 2017 at 09:00 am.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss.  State not revoking on the Felony charge, allow to lapse.  SEHR on misdemeanor charge.  Discussion on offering expungment again, in light of defendant's actions.  Attorneys Fox and Poss respond.  Court responded.  Criminal thinking.  Was offered a diversion.  Revocation summary, violations noted by the court.  Court will not allow the charge to be expunged.  Court will allow the cases to be rescheduled for further discussion between the defense and State.  Reschedule plea/sentencing and SEHR.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: C.R.S.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Contact Public Defender's Office within 24 hours.

15CF221, 15CM296, 16CF112:  Defendant appears by video from Jackson County Jail w/o counsel.  DA Fox appears for the State.  He has not re-contacted the SPDO but will today.  Correct address:  108 Maplewood Ct #24, BRF.  DA Fox requests $1000 cash bond to cover all 3 cases with conditions requested by DA.  Will adjourn day to day but will set for status 1-9-17 at 3:00 until an attorney is assigned and they schedule otherwise.
cancel per SO a.m. sheet; custody JASO
No appearance by defendant.  Per SPD William Poss present states they no longer represent.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Requests a warrant.  Time tolled on the DPA.
to revoke deferred prosecution agreement
MH scheduled at request of DA's office.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Poss.  Victim notification complied with.  Defense waived the filing of the information.  Defendant plead no contest to Counts 1 and 2 and in 15CM296 plead no contest to Count 1.  Count 2 in 15CM296 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court advised the defendant of the possible penalties of the charge he is pleading to.  He understood.  Felony warnings given.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Finding withheld on the felony count.  Found guilty of the misdemeanor counts.  Court reviewed the diversion agreement with the defendant.  He understands the conditions.  Joint recommendation for 2 years probation on the misdemeanor counts.  If he successfully completes probation and the diversion, he may apply for expungement.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 2 years probation on the misdemeanor counts.  Diversion agreement approved on the felony count.  Probation conditions:    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  AODA, if recommended.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Pursue HSED or GED, or it's equivalent.  Obtain and maintain employment, commensurate with his treatment and educational needs.  Attend JCI reality, if agent recommends.  CC, DNA sample and surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision.  If he successfully completes probation and the diversion, he may apply for expungement.  LOA not less that 500 words, to the victims.  To be pre-approved by his agent.  No contact with the victims, residences, businesses or their family.  Refund bond to the poster.

Court questioned the defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.   Defendant stated that he understood the waiver.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to a preliminary hearing.
